messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...>
wrote:
>
> Is Milt actually taking the high road, or did he not get the joke?
You might have to write it in kanji rather than romaji.
>
> Pretty hard to make an attribution much better than Inu no Oshiko.
The various Myochin groups made some small, thick guards, but this
doesn't really look like their work.
>
> Excuse me in advance for encouraging those involved.
> Jim
>

me taking the moral highground ? NEVER !!
Coming from -t, there must be a joke hidden somewhere..........

Dr. Lewitt spent some time in putting the whole koshirae together to
fit the age of the sword......the menuki is particularly fine

milt

messages.subject: Re: to draw attention away from...........
messages.msgSnippet: Inu-san s Patination Formulae comes in second best to Niko-sama s Repatination and Iron Locating Toxifier. Never lose a piece in a dark corner again. John ...
messages.messageBody:
Inu-san's Patination Formulae comes in second best to Niko-sama's
Repatination and Iron Locating Toxifier. Never lose a piece in a
dark corner again. John

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: to draw attention away from...........
messages.msgSnippet: Is Milt actually taking the high road, or did he not get the joke?  You might have to write it in kanji rather than romaji. Pretty hard to make an attribution
messages.messageBody:
Is Milt actually taking the high road, or did he not get the joke? You might have to write it in kanji rather than romaji.

Pretty hard to make an attribution much better than Inu no Oshiko. The various Myochin groups made some small, thick guards, but this doesn't really look like their work.

Excuse me in advance for encouraging those involved.
Jim

ex-Dr. Lewitt collection...........
no, I didn't spray paint on it , nor plug in the lead ( Mr. Dick C.
used up all the lead )

milt

>
> BTW Milt -

from

> digs a hole, puts in a tsuba, sprays it with secret "patinating
> liquid" and then buries it for six months to a year...
> -t

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] to draw attention away from...........
messages.msgSnippet: BTW Milt - Are you talking about the boars-eye tsuba? I would say it is from the Inuno Oshiko school. Thats the special technique where Inu-san digs a hole,
messages.messageBody:
BTW Milt -
Are you talking about the boars-eye tsuba? I would say it is from
the Inuno Oshiko school. Thats the special technique where Inu-san
digs a hole, puts in a tsuba, sprays it with secret "patinating
liquid" and then buries it for six months to a year...
-t
